game.deck: A sci-fi themed first-person action runner. Supports up to 32-person multiplayer and the Oculus Rift.
game.description:
Overview

Infinity Runner is a first person parkour running game set in the far future on a giant spaceship in an unknown part of the galaxy.

Deep inside this ship something terrible hunts you. The story unfolds itself in the game and you learn who you really are and why you are left on the ship. Infinity Runner focuses on a prisoner desperately trying to escape the decaying ship and the clutches of the terror within.

The player will need to run through the ship from the dank and dark prison they were kept in to the wide open spaces of monumental Bio Domes trying to find a way out. Whilst on this journey they will need to traverse large sections of the ship but jumping across platforms, running down the side of the ship in space, avoiding debris and giant asteroids and collecting energy cores to allow them to progress through the vast expanses of the ship before it collides into an unknown planet.

Infinity Runner is developed and published by Wales Interactive for PC, Mac, Linux, Wii U, Xbox One, and PS4 platforms.
game.name: Infinity Runner

game.deck: The 26th annual Madden NFL football game.
game.description:
Overview

This is the 2014 version of EA's long standing football simulation franchise. This year's version marks the second time the franchise was released on the Xbox One and PS4, but it's still being released on the previous generation's platforms.

Seattle Seahawks cornerback RIchard Sherman is the cover athlete after winning a fan vote via ESPN.

Ray Rice Removal

In early September, EA Sports announced that running back Ray Rice would be removed in the following tuning update to the game, removing him from the roster and making him unavailable in the free agency. This was a response to the Ray Rice incident involving domestic violence which led to Rice's dismissal from the Baltimore Ravens and his suspension from the NFL.
game.name: Madden NFL 15

game.deck: The sequel to Stealth Bastard/Stealth Inc., A Game of Clones features a more open world map and a greater emphasis on exploration.
game.description:
Overview

Stealth Inc. 2: A Game of Clones is a stealth based puzzle-platformer developed and published by Curve Digital. It is the sequel to Stealth Bastard / Stealth Inc. A Clone in the Dark. Unlike its predecessor, which offered a linear approach to its puzzles, A Game of Clones connects its puzzles with a hub world. The hub world gates its progression but making certain areas only accessible through upgrades, it also contains collectibles and its on set of secrets to discover. The game features 60 puzzles throughout its 5 distinct areas and even offers a level editor to help extend the life of the game.

Gameplay

The game revolves around goggle-wearing humanoid clones who are looking to escape a futuristic cloning and testing facility. The player will navigate the hub world in order to get to specific puzzle rooms, the puzzle rooms contain a clone that must be rescued. In order to rescue the clone the player must use his gadgets and the different equipment provided in the room to reach the exit. Each puzzle room ranks the player, this is based on the time it took to complete, number of deaths, and times spotted, players can compare their times on the platform specific leaderboard.

Development

Stealth Inc. 2 was originally released as a Wii U exclusive on October 30, 2014. The PC and Xbox One versions of the game were released on April 3, 2015 with the PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3 and PlayStation Vita versions being released shortly after on April 7, 2015.
game.name: Stealth Inc. 2: A Game of Clones

game.deck: Fenix Rage is a masocore platformer from Green Lava Studios.
game.description:
Overview

Fenix Rage is a platformer developed by Costa Rican developer Green Lava Studios. It was originally released for PC on September 24, 2014, and is coming to PlayStation 4, PlayStation Vita and Xbox One sometime in 2015. The game features over 200 levels spanning 9 worlds, each world featuring their own unique challenges and boss battle.

Story

Fenix's village is destroyed in an explosion that freezes everything in its wake except for Fenix and the mysterious Oktarus. Fenix must track down Oktarus to uncover why his village was destroyed in that icy explosion.

Gameplay

Players control Fenix, Fenix can infinitely jump and dash. The goal is to get Fenix to a blue door located somewhere in the level while avoiding enemies and pitfalls. Hitting an enemy or going off screen results in an instant death requiring the player to start the level over again, re-spawns happen instantaneously. Located in each level is a cookie, which is placed in a difficult to access area. These act as a collectible, players that collect enough cookies will be rewarded with cookie recipes to be used out of game. Each level has a par time, achieving a par time will reward the player with a star for that level. Also featured is a Challenge Mode, limiting the amount of dashes and jumps that Fenix can make.
game.name: Fenix Rage

But Candice won't let him go so easily, and he finds his escape hampered by the city itself.

This game promises improvements to True Performance Skating, one touch deking, player and puck physics, and team AI. Jerseys will be individually modeled with live physics. NBC Sports' TV presentation for the NHL will be adapted into the game's UI and transitions, with real video introductions.

The new commentary team is Mike "Doc" Emrick and Eddie Olczyk on play by play and color respective, with Ray Ferraro doing on-ice reporting. They replace series mainstays Gary Thorne and Bill Clement.

EA Sports Hockey League will not be returning for current generation consoles, but a 6v6 multiplayer mode is planned for a post-release patch.

game.aliases: Diablo III: Reaper of Souls - Ultimate Evil Edition Diablo 3: Ultimate Evil Edition Diablo 3: Reaper of Souls - Ultimate Evil Edition
game.deck: Diablo III: Ultimate Evil Edition brings both Diablo III and its expansion, Reaper of Souls, to consoles (including the series' debut on PlayStation 4 and Xbox One) in one package with several new, exclusive features.
game.description:
Overview

Diablo III: Ultimate Evil Edition includes both the original release of Diablo III and its expansion, Diablo III: Reaper of Souls, in one package. Originally announced only for PlayStation 4, Ultimate Evil Edition is also available for PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, and Xbox One.

New Features

The Ultimate Evil Edition includes several features that are unique to this version of the game.

Avenger Kills

When a player dies in combat, the monster that killed him/her sometimes levels up and then enters the game of someone on that player's friends list, whether that second player is currently online or not. In the second player's game, this monster is labeled as the "Bane" of his/her friend. If the player is able to avenge his/her friend, they both get a share of the loot. If the Bane monster kills the second player, it levels up again and enters the game of a friend of the second player. This process can continue several times until the Bane monster simply becomes too powerful and "retires."

Apprentice Mode

This new mode allows lower level players the ability to temporarily get a boost when playing with higher level friends.

In-Game Mail

Players can trade items between each other via an in-game mail system.

Player Gifts

When a legendary item drops, there is a chance that second legendary will drop with it but with the name of a friend attached to it. It is that players' duty to send the gift to his/her friend. So, even though some friends may not be able to play at the same time, they all benefit from each other playing.

Character Transfer

Those who have played Diablo III on PlayStation 3 or Xbox 360 are able to transfer their characters to Ultimate Evil Edition on any platform regardless of which one they originally played. For example, an Xbox 360 player can transfer his/her save to PlayStation 4.

PlayStation Exclusives

The PlayStation versions of Ultimate Evil Edition include several "PlayStation inspired" items that can be found throughout the game. These include Drake's Amulet from the Uncharted series and a shoulder item inspired by Journey. Certain types of the zombie-like 'Infected' from The Last of Us also appear as enemies throughout the game.

Launch Day Bonus

Those who purchase Ultimate Evil Edition on launch day are eligible to receive a bonus item; Infernal Pauldrons, which provide regenerating health and cooldown reduction.
game.name: Diablo III: Ultimate Evil Edition

game.deck: Far Cry 4 puts the player in the role of Ajay Ghale and pits him against a deadly antagonist and an even deadlier environment. Caught in the middle of a brutal Civil War while fulfilling his mother's dying wish, Ghale must fight back against the oppression of Kyrat's leader, Pagan Min, while also battling the ruthlessness of the jungle.
game.description:
Overview

Far Cry 4 is the fourth entry in Ubisoft's popular Far Cry series. Like Far Cry 2, 3, and Blood Dragon before it, Far Cry 4 tells its own unique story with its own unique cast of characters. This time the game play takes place within a jungle of weaponized animals which players will be able to use to help liberate various fortresses.

A unique feature of the PlayStation 4 version is the ability for players to play co-op with other players who don't own the game. The owner of the game will get a select number of "Keys to Kyrat" which when gifted to a friend allows them to play the game unbounded for two hours time. Reportedly, each owner of the game will get 10 of these keys.

Development

Far Cry 4 was announced on May 15th, 2014, complete with its US release for November 18th, 2014. Due to the increased popularity of the series after Far Cry 3, Far Cry 4 continues with its predecessor's more colorful tone and accessible design.

Racism Controversy

The announcement included what was implied to be the boxart for Far Cry 4, which depicted what many assumed to be a white man wearing a pink suit resting his hand on a colored man holding a grenade. The imagery was thusly believed to promote racist overtones -- notably by such video game-focused sites as Kotaku.

Creative director Alex Hutchinson then soon took to Twitter to confirm that the pink suit man is in fact Asian--specifically an invading Chinese crime lord--and is not the player character. It was then eventually confirmed that he is the game's villain, Pagan Min.

System Requirements

MINIMUM:

  • OS: Windows 7 (SP1) / Windows 8 / Windows 8.1 / (64-bit only)
  • Processor: 2.6 GHz Intel Core i5-750 or 3.2 GHz AMD Phenom II X4 955
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 or AMD Radeon HD5850 (1 GB VRAM)
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Hard Drive: 30 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX-compatible (5.1 surround sound recommended)

RECOMMENDED:

  • OS: Windows 7 (SP1) / Windows 8 / Windows 8.1 / (64-bit only)
  • Processor: 2.5 GHz Intel Core i5-2400S or 4.0 GHz AMD FX-8350 or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 680 or AMD Radeon R9 290X or better (2 GB VRAM)
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Hard Drive: 30 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX-compatible (5.1 surround sound recommended)
game.name: Far Cry 4

game.deck: A fighting game for PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, and PC set in the Dragon Ball Z universe.
game.description:
History

Dragon Ball XenoVerse was initially announced in the July 2014 issue of V-Jump as "Dragon Ball New Project". Scant information was released about the game, but images seemed to revolve around a mysterious, red-haired man with a scouter, cape, and a Capsule Corp. logo on his shoulder. At E3 2014, the game's actual title, Dragon Ball XenoVerse was revealed. Gamescom 2014 saw the reveal of the mysterious young man's importance - he was a created character chosen to showcase the game's Create-A-Character mode.

Plot

Time Patrol officer Trunks has charged the player with visiting key events in the Dragon Ball universe. Trunks works alongside the Supreme Kai of Time to keep history balanced and stop those who may try to alter the timeline.

Various time distortions and alterations have been happening randomly, and the player is recruited as a Time Patroller to stop it and keep history flowing the way it was. This usually involves the player finding themselves in familiar classic battles from the Dragon Ball universe to help fight the mysteriously powered up antagonists.

As the story progresses, it is eventually revealed that many of these distortions were causes by Towa, sister of Dabura, and her created bodyguard, Mira.

Shortly after Mira is defeated, it is revealed that the Demon God Demigra has been pulling the strings from within his imprisonment. Eventually Demigra is freed, leaving the player to try to stop him.

At the end of the game, Demigra is defeated by the player, causing the flow of time to return to normal, at least for the moment.

Connection to Other Games

Dragon Ball Xenoverse borrows extensively from Dragon Ball Online, the Japan and South Korea-only MMORPG. Time Patrol Trunks' design and designation is lifted directly from that game, as is the game's plot of traveling throughout the series' history. A great number of the sample Create-A-Characters shown in officially released screenshots also closely resemble the sample Create-A-Characters used to promote Dragon Ball Online.

At Tokyo Game Show 2014, it was revealed that Towa and Mira, the main antagonists of Dragon Ball Online, would appear in XenoVerse, as well as the Supreme Kai of Time, a character briefly mentioned in DB Online.

Gameplay

Developed by Dimps Corporation, Dragon Ball XenoVerse, like many other Dragon Ball games, is a fighting game where players face off against an AI or human opponent(s). Players can control one of the many iconic Dragon Ball Z characters, or use their own creations thanks to the character creation system.

Character Creation

Dragon Ball XenoVerse features an extensive character creation system, with five different races and tons of customization options available. Players can create up to eight different created characters, which would allow you to create one of every race and gender. (Namekians and Frieza Clan have only one gender.)

Each Race has different stats and benefits. The races are:

Earthlings: Balanced offense and defense. Their ki recharges automatically, and when maxed out, Earthlings gain a boost to their attack stat.

Saiyans: Low health, but high attack. If the players health is 25% or less, Saiyans gain a boost to their attack. If a Saiyan is knocked out in battle and then revived, the Saiyan will gain boosts in all of his or her stats. Male Saiyans have a higher attack power, but suffer weaker special skills. Female Saiyans have faster ki and stamina recovery, but suffer from lower health.

Namekians: Health stat is high, while attack is low. Health and stamina recovery is faster, and items used by Namekians are 1.5 times more effective than the other races.

Majin: High defense, but stamina recovery is low.The higher the stamina, the less damage is received. Male Majins have higher health, but are generally slower. Vice versa, females have lower health but are faster.

Frieza Clan: High speed, low attack. Speed increases when health drops below 50%. They have a special ability that allows them to paralyze their opponents with an energy beam.

Transformations

Each race in the game has access to the Kaioken, which effectively boosts the players stats but also drains stamina.

Saiyans can transform into a Super Saiyan, and an Ascended Super Saiyan (Commonly referred to as Super Saiyan 2). While Dimps and Bandai Namco were trying to get Super Saiyan 3 for created characters, the idea was eventually scrapped, likely due to balancing and cosmetic issues. Characters such as Goku and Gotenks remain unaffected by this, however.

Interestingly, XenoVerse allows female Saiyans to transform into Super Saiyans (and by extension, Super Saiyan 2) which were never featured in the anime or manga.

DLC

Dragon Ball XenoVerse will receive three downloadable content packs after the game launches. The packs can be purchased individually for $9.99 each, or bundled together in a season pass for $24.99.

DLC Pack 1 - Adds three playable characters (GT Goku, Pan, GT Trunks), four Time Patrol quests, 12 quests, 15 new special moves for created characters, and five new costumes. This pack will launch in March of 2015.

DLC Pack 2 - Adds Nuova and Eis Shenron as well as Mira and Towa as playable characters, quests, special moves, and costumes. This pack does not currently have a release date.

DLC Pack 3 - Adds Turtle Hermit Set, Jaco, and other exclusive content. This pack does not currently have a release date.

Additionally, those who pre-order the game will receive a one time use code to redeem which contains an exclusive playable character (Super Saiyan 4 Vegeta) and special Gold and Crystal versions of the Frieza battle suits.

PC System Requirements

Minimum
Operating SystemWindows Vista (x64) / Windows 7 (x64)
ProcessorIntel Core 2 Duo 2.4Ghz / AMD Athlon 64 X2 5200+, 2.6GHz
Memory2 GB of RAM
Graphics512 MB Nvidia GeForce 8800 / ATI Radeon HD 3870
DirectXVersion 9.0c
NetworkBroadband Internet connection
Hard Drive10 GB
Recommended
Operating SystemWindows Vista (x64) / Windows 7 (x64) / Windows 8 (x64)
ProcessorIntel Core i3-530, 2.93 GHz / AMD Phenom II X4 940, 3.0GHz
Memory4 GB of RAM
Graphics1 GB Nvidia GeForce GTX 550Ti / AMD Radeon HD 6790
DirectXVersion 9.0c
NetworkBroadband Internet connection
Hard Drive10 GB
game.name: Dragon Ball XenoVerse

game.deck: EA's annual soccer release is back for the year 2014.
game.description:
New Features

Note: Most of these features are most likely only available for the Ignite Engine versions (PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4).

Emotional Intelligence

All 22 players on the pitch have an attitude (emotion) towards any other teammate or opponent. For example if a player gets fouled by the same opponent repeatedly he might be angry and confront him, players might get frustrated if a teammate striker repeatedly misses the target, but they would of course change their attitude if that striker were to score a last-minute winning goal. All these emotions are told by over 600 new animations.

Team Tactics

Players of both a player's side and the AI side will better understand the situation in a match and adjust accordingly. Examples include more frequent crosses when there is little time and a goal is needed or heading the ball for the corner flag in order to waste time while ahead.

System Requirements

  • Hard Drive Space Required: 15.0 GB

game.deck: Harmonix is going back to its roots and producing a new Amplitude for PS3 and PS4.
game.description:
Overview

This Amplitude is a reimagining of the 2003 Harmonix game of the same name (which was itself a sequel to Frequency). In order to get the game partially funded, Harmonix turned to Kickstarter to ask for contributions amounting $775,000 from fans. Some of the rewards for pledging included being involved in the song decision process for the game, including one's song in the game (provided that person owned the rights to said song), being a part of Harmonix's panels at PAX Prime and PAX East, Dinner with Harmonix's co-founders, Dinner with Tim Schafer, or being flown out to Harmonix headquarters for various activities. The Kickstarter reached its goal with about 20 hours remaining on May 22nd, 2014. The game was planned for release in Early 2015 on PSN for PS3, and PS4 (Vita is planned as a stretch goal but has not been confirmed at this time). However, after first being delayed until late summer 2015 in June of that year Harmonix announced that the game's scope was being extended and therefore the release date was being pushed back to early 2016, with backers of the appropriate tier being given access to the PS4 version in December 2015.

Artists

In addition to songs submitted by fans and original songs created by Harmonix specifically for the game, they also announced that the following artists would be contributing songs to the game:

  • C418 All the Time
  • Danny Baranowsky Crypteque (1-2)
  • Darren Korb Impossible
  • Freezepop - Phantoms
  • George & Jonathan Crystal
  • Jim Guthrie Force Quit
  • Kodomo Red Giant
  • Symbion Project Concept

Autumn Games also confirmed that the track Unfinished Business from Skullgirls would be playable in the game. Anamanaguchi has been announced as contributing music to the game.
game.name: Amplitude

game.deck: This Battlefield spin-off, developed by Visceral Games, focuses on the neverending battle between criminals and police officers, rather than the series' standard military setting.
game.description:
Overview

Battlefield Hardline is a first-person shooter developed by Visceral Games for the Xbox One, Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4 and the PC. This is the first game in the Battlefield franchise to be developed by Visceral Games. The game steps away from its military setting and instead features a law enforcement versus criminals backdrop.

Gameplay

With the shift from military to law enforcement there are a couple notable changes to the single-player and multiplayer experiences.

Single-player

The single-player gameplay largely goes unchanged from the other entries in the Battlefield franchise aside from a few additional mechanics and tools. The most notable addition is the ability to arrest enemies, upon approaching a group of criminals the player can flash their badge freezing the enemies in place. The player then has the option to arrest the criminals one at a time, however the player must keep their firearm fixed on the enemies or they will become hostile again and pick up their weapons. If the mission provides a partner the partner will keep the remaining enemies at bay while the payer arrests them.

The next addition is the ability to toss shell casings to distract enemies, it functions similarly to the rocks players can throw in Far Cry 3. This works great in tandem with the arresting mechanic, distract an enemy then sneak up behind and make an arrest.

There are also new tools available to the player. The player can equip a taser which can be used to take down an enemy non-lethally, this is useful for incapacitating a high-value target from a distance. The player is also given a scanner, this gives the player the ability to tag enemies and alarms, identify high value targets and log evidence.

Multiplayer

Hardline adds some new modes that change up the gameplay experience quite a bit for veterans of Battlefield. The new game modes are Heist, Blood Money, Hotwire, Rescue and Crosshair.

Heist

The criminal team is tasked with breaking into a vault or armored truck that is filled with cash. The criminals must then move that cash to an extraction point located elsewhere on the map. The law enforcement team is tasked with stopping the opposing team from extracting the cash. If all the cash is extracted then the criminals win, if time expires or the criminals run out of tickets then the police win.

Blood Money

Both criminal and law enforcement teams are tasked with retrieving cash from a centralized location. Once cash has been collected it must be moved to the teams vault located near that teams spawn point. Vaults that are holding cash can be raided by the opposing team, this means teams must also protect cash that has already been extracted from the central location. The game ends when a team reaches a set amount of cash in their vault, or when time expires, the team with the most cash is awarded the victory.

Hotwire

Both police and criminals are tasked with capturing marked vehicles on the map, in order to capture a vehicle the player driving must reach a certain speed and continue driving. Once a vehicle is captured it will begin to reduce the opposing teams tickets, the more vehicles held the quicker the tickets deplete. In order for a team to win the opposing teams tickets must reach zero. This mode most resembles Conquest mode from the other Battlefield entries, with vehicles replacing flags.

Rescue

The law enforcement team is charged with rescuing hostages from the criminal team. The police win if all hostages are rescued or if they eliminate all of the criminals. The criminals win if the entirety of the law enforcement team is eliminated.

Crosshair

The criminal team is charged with eliminating a VIP being protected by the law enforcement team, the VIP is a former criminal turned states witness. The criminals win if the VIP is eliminated or all law enforcement officers are killed. The police win if all criminals are eliminated or they escort the VIP to the extraction zone.

Development

Details about the game leaked on May 27 in an update to EA's Battlelog service, which included assets and info ahead of the official announcement. Soon after, a gameplay trailer emerged that used the codename "Omaha." Visceral Games VP Steve Papoutsis officially confirmed the game's existence in a post on EA's website that same day, mentioning that Hardline would begin "a whole new series in the Battlefield franchise."
game.name: Battlefield Hardline

game.deck: Killing Floor 2 is the sequel to the cooperative survival horror wave-based first-person shooter Killing Floor
game.description:
Early Access begins April 21, 2015 at the price of $30/20/27.

Perks

Returning from Killing Floor are the Berserker, Commando, Support, Sharpshooter, Firebug, Demolitions, and the Field Medic perks. New perks include Gunslinger, SWAT, and Martial Artist. In order to remove the lengthy grind in Killing Floor, Tripwire Interactive, LLC opted to split each perk into 25 levels with a shorter grind in between levels. Every 5 levels, players will be able to choose between 1 of 2 "upgrades", such as the Supplier upgrade for a level 5 Support, which allows teammates to collect 1 full magazine for their weapons every wave from the player. These upgrades can be switched around and will apply at the end of a wave, just like picking a perk.

Commando

Weapon Damage + 1% per level

Cloaked Enemy Detection + 2m per level

Health Bar Detection + 2m per level

Zed Time Extension + 1 + 1/5 seconds per level

Health Increase + 2% per level

Support

Welding Proficiency + 2% per level

Shotgun Damage + 1% per level

Shotgun Penetration + 25% per level

Grenade Damage + 2% per level

Berserker

Melee Damage + 1% per level

Attack Speed + 5% + .8% per level

Movement + 10% + .6% per level

Bloat Bile Resistance 25%

Damage Resistance 5%

Siren Resistance 25%

Field Medic

Syringe Recharge Rate + 8% per level

Syringe Potency + 2% per level

Bloat Bile Resistance + 3% per level

Movement Speed + 1% per level

Armor Bonus + 3% per level
game.name: Killing Floor 2

game.deck: The tenth installment of the bloody and storied fighting game franchise picks up decades after the events of the 2011 franchise re-boot, as new and returning kombatants fight throughout the realms over the power of an imprisoned evil.
game.description:
Overview

Mortal Kombat X (pronounced with the letter "X", not the number 10) is a 2.5D fighting game developed by NetherRealm and published by WB for the Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and PC (via Steam, ported by High Voltage) on April 14, 2015. Ports for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 (both also by High Voltage) were delayed several times, before being finally announced to have been canceled on August 28, 2015.

The tenth main entry in the long-running Mortal Kombat franchise, Mortal Kombat X is the first installment to be released for the eighth generation of gaming consoles. Building off its predecessor (2011's Mortal Kombat), the game adds a variety of new gameplay mechanics, including the ability to directly interact with the environment (straight from Injustice: Gods Among Us), multiple variations for all playable characters (each with unique abilities), and a new set of bonus finishing moves (including a variation of Brutality from Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3, which now serves as a hidden brutal enhancement of the character's final attack). Also returning from UMK3 is the ability to quickly run forward (complete with a regenerating "sprint gauge"), although it is now performed by double-tapping forward (rather than its own dedicated button).

The main single-player story takes place over 20 years after the events of the previous game (continuing the plot's "alternate timeline" where thunder god Raiden's visions from the original timeline influences key changes in the plot). A few years after the destruction of Shao Kahn, wicked Elder God Shinnok (with the help of sorceror Quan Chi) had invaded Earthrealm with the forces of the Netherrealm, only to be imprisoned (after a defeat by Johnny Cage) in his amulet. When the power of the amulet is later used by Mileena during a civil war in Outworld (between her Tarkatan army and the forces of emperor Kotal Kahn), it's up to a new Special Forces team of fighters (Cassie Cage, Jacqui Briggs, Takahashi Takeda, and Kung Jin) to recover the amulet before it falls into the wrong hands.

Like Freddy Krueger in the previous game, Mortal Kombat X includes downloadable guest characters from famous movie franchises: Jason Voorhees from the Friday the 13th horror series and a Predator from the sci-fi action series of the same name.

Story

While the bulk of the story takes place in a set time frame (over 20 years after the events of the previous entry), part of the story is told in flashbacks. Like Mortal Kombat vs. DC Universe, Injustice: Gods Among Us, and the game's previous entry, the game is separated into multiple chapters (with each chapter focused on one of the playable characters, who is the player-controlled character in its fights).

Plot

Chapter 1 - Johnny Cage

The game begins with the revelation that the events of the previous game was manipulated from behind the scenes by fallen Elder God Shinnok, who millennia ago attempted to conquer the EarthRealm but was defeated by Raiden and imprisoned him in the NetherRealm.

In the present day, 2 years after the defeat of Shao Kahn, NetherRealm forces comprised of demons have begun invading the EarthRealm. An armed squadron of choppers including Johnny Cage, Sonya Blade and Kenshi are heading towards a portal that will allow them access to a white lotus sky temple. Their mission is to protect EarthRealm's life force, the Jinsei, which Shinnok is attempting to corrupt.

The choppers are attacked by Scorpion and an undead Sub-Zero (Kuai Liang), the latter having had his conversion to Cyber Sub-Zero reversed by the same magic that made him an undead warrior. After an initial skirmish which sees all the soldiers on the chopper murdered Kenshi telekinetically throws Sub-Zero from the chopper while Sonya attempts to land it. Johnny battles with Scorpion and then Sub-Zero on the ground, joining up with the others and the remaining choppers and surviving soldiers.

At Raiden's sky temple, shaolin monks led by god of thunder Raiden and god of wind Fujin, are attempting to fend off an army of demons led by Shinnok himself, his sorcerer Quan Chi and undead warriors including Jax, Enenra ("Smoke is dead, I am Enenra."), Nightwolf, Sindel (seemingly minus the essence of Shang Tsung), Stryker and Kabal.

Sonya's forces arrive outside the temple and do battle with the demons. After Johnny battles the former Smoke and Jax their forces infiltrate the temple to find Raiden. Meanwhile Shinnok reveals himself to Raiden and Fujin boasting of his power to bring the dead back to life as undead warriors. Raiden and Fujin defeat Sindel, Kabal and Stryker but are attacked by Shinnok who uses his powerful gold and green amulet. On the blink of defeat, Johnny, Sonya and Kenshi arrive just in time to prevent the two gods from being sealed away inside Shinnok's amulet, knocking the amulet to the ground. Shinnok incapacitates Kenshi and Sonya, but is unable to finish off Johnny, who's green power counters Shinnok's own dark power. Johnny kicks the amulet to Raiden who seals away Shinnok inside his own amulet.

20 years later, as Johnny Cage has finished retelling this story (also including the fact that Raiden told him his green power comes from a line of supernatural Mediterranean EarthRealm warriors) to a new team comprised of Cassie Cage, Jacqui Briggs, Takahashi Takeda and Kung Jin, he sends them on a mission to locate Sub-Zero and the Lin Kuei to reaffirm their allegiance to EarthRealm.

Gameplay

Mortal Kombat X builds off of the systems created for the previous Mortal Kombat, utilizing the same button layout and attack format of Front and Back attacks for both fists and feet. Each character has a three-segment super meter that allows for enhanced versions of special moves, combo breakers, and an ultra-damaging X-Ray move. Unlike the previous game, MKX allows players to run by double-tapping and holding toward their opponent. Similar to Mortal Kombat 3, a meter governs just how much a player can run.

During fights, players can hit a button (R1 on PS4, RB on Xbox One) to interact with various background elements. This includes posts that can be launched off of to get away from (or closer to) an opponent, objects that can be thrown as weapons, and so on. Unlike the similar system from Injustice, all characters will interact with objects in the same way.

At the end of each fight, a finishing move, such as a fatality or a brutality, can be performed. Fatalities will be accessible at the end of a fight after the iconic announcer line "Finish Him/Her!" Brutalities in MKX are extended versions of attacks, special moves and throws that continue the animation of said attack, special or throw into a gruesome non-cinematic end for the opponent. There are said to be over 200 brutalities in the game and each has its own conditions players must satisfy during a fight to use them at the end.

Each character will have three different variants that offer different options and moves. These fighting styles are chosen on the character select screen and aren't swappable during a fight. As an example, this allows players to give Scorpion a fireball attack in one form or choose another that allows him to create and launch demonic clones of himself at his foes.

This is done to create different versions of a character that can serve different purposes, such as one version that's good for zoning and another that's focused more on rushdown tactics.

Modes

The game will have a story mode as well as a new set of challenge towers. Unlike the set, offline tower found in Mortal Kombat, MKX has three towers of varying length that update at different intervals, giving players new types of challenges each day. Currency is earned in some modes, but it's unknown if this ties into a "krypt" or other sort of process for unlocking additional material.

Online modes include standard battles that can be played in a ranked or unranked fashion, a king of the hill mode, team battles, and so on. Some modes can be played in a faction-specific configuration to tie into the Faction War metagame.

Metagame

Mortal Kombat X has a fully connected experience with a persistent online metagame called the Faction War. Players will choose one of five factions and actions they perform while playing will contribute to their faction of choice. The leading faction is crowned the winner, and points are reset every week to constantly determine new winners. Players in a winning faction will earn bonuses, some of which may only be active while that faction is the most recent winner.

Characters

Given the 25-year span of time covered in MKX's storyline, many returning characters are shown being, well, older. New-to-the-franchise characters are also making their debut here.

New Characters

  • Cassie Cage
  • DVorah
  • Erron Black
  • Ferra/Torr
  • Jacqueline Briggs
  • Kotal Kahn
  • Kung Jin
  • Takahashi Takeda

Returning Characters

  • Ermac
  • Goro
  • Jax
  • Johnny Cage
  • Kano
  • Kenshi
  • Kitana
  • Kung Lao
  • Liu Kang
  • Mileena
  • Quan Chi
  • Raiden
  • Reptile
  • Scorpion
  • Shinnok
  • Sonya Blade
  • Sub-Zero

Additional characters will be added post-release. Most of the bonus editions of the game include the "Kombat Pack," which is a Season Pass of sorts that includes the additional characters, which are said to be some mix of returning fighters and "iconic" guests.

The Kombat Pack characters include:

  • Jason Voorhees
  • Tanya
  • Tremor
  • Predator

Kombat Pack 2 includes:

  • Bo' Rai Cho
  • Leatherface
  • Alien (Xenomorph)
  • Tri-Borg

Unplayable Story Mode Opponents

  • Baraka
  • Rain
  • Sindel

Development

Rumors regarding a new Mortal Kombat were confirmed by series co-creator Ed Boon after a cryptic countdown via his Twitter account, leading to June 2, 2014. The game was officially unveiled that day along with a CG trailer by Digital Dimensions featuring an original track titled "Can't Be Stopped" by rapper Wiz Khalifa.

The game runs on a vastly updated version of the same Unreal Engine 3-based technology, reformulated for use on the next generation of consoles.

PC System Requirements

Minimum:

  • OS: 64-bit: Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-750, 2.67 GHz | AMD Phenom X4 965, 3.4 GHz
  • Memory: 3 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 | AMD Radeon HD 5850
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Hard Drive: 25 GB available space

Recommended:

  • OS: 64-bit: Windows 7, Windows 8
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-3770, 3.4 GHz | AMD FX-8350, 4.0 GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 | AMD Radeon HD 7950
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Hard Drive: 40 GB available space
game.name: Mortal Kombat X

game.deck: A visual novel developed and published by 5pb. Taking place during the first six episodes of the anime series, featuring an original story starring a new male and female protagonist.
game.description:
Overview

Psycho-Pass: Mandatory Happiness is a visual novel developed and published by 5pb. The game was released in Japan on May 28, 2015 on the Xbox One.

Story

Set in the near feature, the year 2112. Emotions, desires and social diseases are all documented and managed by the government, as knows as the Sibyl System. Determined by the government, people are assigned a number that will shape a person's lifestyle. This number is known as a Psycho-Pass. The system also has the ability to calculate a person's Crime Coefficient, this represents a individual's criminal capacity, which is measured by officers using the Sibyl System issued Dominator Portable Psychological Diagnosis and Suppression System, a handgun which once aimed at a criminal determines their Psycho-Pass and sets to 1 or 3 modes, Non-Lethal Paralyzer, Lethal Eliminator and Destroy Decomposer. There are two groups of officers, the Enforcers and the Inspectors. Enforcers are people with high Crime Coefficient, once criminals now officers of the law, they assist the Inspectors who use their criminal mind to solve cases. Inspectors are the people who command and watch over Enforcers, making sure they stay in line.

The game will take place during the first six episodes of the first anime season and will feature a original story that stars a new male and female character, Enforcer Takuma Tsurugi and Inspector Nadeshiko Kugatachi. These two will serve as the protagonist of the game who will battle against a new enemy. Characters from the anime will make an appearance. Writer Gen Urobuchi, the creator of the series, will be providing script supervision for the game's story.

Links

  • Official Website
game.name: Psycho-Pass: Mandatory Happiness

game.deck: A surreal first person game where a protagonist must help an artist, filmmaker and musician by altering the past and present. The game is developed by Day For Night Games, a team of ex-Irrational Games developers led by Joe Fielder.
game.description:
Development

Producer Joe Fielder has said that the game will take place within The Equinox, a surreal theater-like experience similar to the Black Lodge dream sequences in the TV show Twin Peaks.

The game will be funded through a Kickstarter campaign, planned to begin in July 2014.
game.name: The Black Glove

game.deck: The Escapists is a game developed by Mouldy Toof Studios that showcases prison life.
game.description:
Overview

The Escapists is a strategy game developed by Mouldy Toof Studios and Team17 Software Limited for the PC, Xbox One, and PlayStation 4. The game showcases what everyday prison life is in a light hearted manner. The objective of the game is to escape but the real game is how a player pulls off the escape.

System Requirements

  • OS: Windows XP
  • Processor: Dual Core CPU 2.4 gHz
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000, Nvidia GeForce 8000, ATI Radeon HD 4800 Series
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Sound Card: Windows Compatible Card
  • Additional Notes: In some instances, systems may require model specific drivers. If your system manufacturers no longer support hardware under this category, it may not be possible to run this title. Should this be the case, we are unable to assist you and recommend that you pursue support from your respective system manufacturer. This issue is most common in laptops and is prevalent with select products from most leading manufacturers.

Links

  • Official site
  • Steam Page
  • Xbox Store Page
game.name: The Escapists

game.deck: A side-scrolling "Metroidvania" game featuring a Goddess with three distinct forms. Funded through Kickstarter in June 2014.
game.name: Red Goddess: Inner World

game.name: Gunship X

game.deck: A surreal adventure game, where the player must make hard choices as an entire community faces death within 6 hours from a hallucinogenic poison.

game.deck: Fantastical runner about two heroes trying to take back the Earth which has been besieged by giant flying dragons.

game.name: MechRunner

game.name: NBA Live 15

game.deck: Tetris for a new generation, designed to celebrate the series' 30th anniversary.
game.description:
Overview

Another take on the classic block matching game, this time from Ubisoft.
game.name: Tetris Ultimate

game.deck: The third game in the Unwritten Tales adventure game series.
game.description:
Overview

The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 is an adventure game developed by KING Art Games and published on February 19th, 2015 by Nordic Games for PC, Mac, and Linux platforms. A port to Playstation 4 and Xbox One came out on September 22th, 2015.
game.name: The Book of Unwritten Tales 2

game.deck: A follow up to 2013's Tomb Raider reboot. After the events of the previous game, Lara spends one year searching to explain what she saw. Her quest to explain immortality leads her to Siberia, home of a mythical city known as Kitezh.
game.description:
Overview

The second game in the rebooted Tomb Raider canon has Lara deal with the consequences of the events of the first game and accept newfound identity as a survival specialist and adventurer. The game is being developed by Crystal Dynamics for the Xbox One and Xbox 360 with a Holiday 2015 release window. The Xbox 360 version is being handled by Nixxes Software BV. A PC version is set to follow in Early 2016 and a PS4 version is scheduled for late 2016.

Actress Camilla Luddington and writer Rhianna Pratchett reprise their respective roles from the original Tomb Raider in 2013.

Gameplay

Building upon the previous game and taking cues from other franchises, Lara can now swim underwater, hide in foliage, and climb trees. There is also much more emphasis on "tomb raiding" than there was in the previous game.
game.name: Rise of the Tomb Raider

game.deck: An isometric action-adventure game where players must puzzle and platform their way through tombs and engage in dual-stick shooter combat.
game.description:
Overview

Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris is a isometric action-adventure game developed by Crystal Dynamics for the PC, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. It is the sequel to the critically acclaimed Lara Croft and the Guardian of Light. It features cooperative multiplayer for up to 4 players.

Story

Lara Croft and her rival treasure hunter, Carter Bell, are tomb raiding in Egypt when they come across a tomb containing Osiris's staff. In an effort to best Lara, Carter quickly touches the staff before Lara can stop him and the two become cursed. Touching the staff also releases Isis and Horus from their imprisonment. The two gods inform Lara and Carter that the curse is Set's doing and that they wont be safe until they break the curse and restore Osiris's rule over Egypt. The gods go onto explain that after Set betrayed Osiris he cut Osiris's body into pieces and scattered them throughout the tombs located in this area. In order to break the curse the two archaeologists must locate all of the pieces of Osiris and restore him so that he can deal with Set and restore balance to Egypt.

Development

Crystal Dynamics began work on the game in 2013 following the release of the franchises gritty reboot, Tomb Raider. Nixxes Software helped in the development of the game, and had previously helped out Crystal Dynamics on other Tomb Raider titles. The studios concluded work on the project in November of 2014 and released the following month on December 9, 2014.
game.name: Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris

game.deck: A completely reprogrammed version of Two Brothers on a new engine and with brand new combat.
game.name: Chromophore: The Two Brothers Director's Cut

game.deck: The next title in Ubisoft's hugely successful dance game franchise.
game.name: Just Dance 2015

game.deck: A first-person tactical shooter developed by Ubisoft Montreal Studios. In this installment of the Rainbow Six series, some players are focused on assault where as others are defense-oriented.
game.description:
Overview

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Siege is a first-person shooter in the Tom Clancy franchise developed by Ubisoft Montreal Studios developed for the Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and PC.

The game focuses on close quarter combat, one team defends a hostage, the main objective, while a counter terrorist Rainbow team attacks. The defending team has the ability to fortify their surroundings, create traps for the attacking team and create defensive systems and strategies to stop the attacking team. The attacking Rainbow teams must breach the fortified location and rescue the hostage using coordinated assaults and close quarters combat. The game is powered by Ubisoft's Anvil Next game engine which features a high level of environment destruction, enabling the destruction of ceilings, floors and walls.

Terrorist Hunt (PVE)

The game has also added the fan beloved Terrorist Hunt game-mode featuring PVE (players vs. computer enemies) in similar environments, the mode has goals of killing all of the Terrorists/computer characters, disarming bombs, extracting hostages, or protecting an asset (defensive mode). The AI terrorists will react to sound and movement and take advantage of all of the new features in Rainbow Six: Siege. There are certain types of enemies including suicide-bombers, scouts, and general enemies. Scanning and enemy with a camera of any kind will reveal the 'class' of that unit.

Engineer: will focus solely on setting barricades and traps and other devices.

Roamer: will rely on setting up group attacks, and attempt to flank you at opportune times.

Bomber: will walk/charge towards you at all costs and self-detonate, they are heavily armored and strapped with explosives.

"Team Rainbow has been reactivated in order to take down the worlds most dangerous terrorist threat yet, the White Masks."

The game mode features something being called "Siege Generator" which ensures "you will never have the same experience twice." Randomized enemy positions, classes, objectives, and more. It features 11 different maps currently, all with a day and night variety.

Terrorist Hunt difficulty levels include the old school realistic mode (being the most difficult.) along with the classics of easy, medium, and hard.

Characters

Players pick a character at the start of each round, each with their own abilities and weapons. There is also a standard "Recruit" available in case a player has no valid choices available to them. The Recruit has no special abilities, but can use an offensive gadget and a defensive gadget in the same loadout. Renown points earned during gameplay are spent to unlock additional characters.

The base cost of a character is 500 Renown. However, as you unlock characters from a CTU, more characters from that same CTU will increase in cost by intervals of 500.

OperatorCTUTeamAbility
SledgeSASAttackersUses a breaching hammer to break walls and other surfaces.
ThatcherSASAttackersUses EMP grenades to disable electronics.
MuteSASDefendersCan deploy jamming devices to scramble signals and hide objectives.
game.name: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Siege

game.deck: A third-person survival horror game that melds aspects of both horror and noir themes together.
game.name: White Night

game.deck: Entwined is a dual-stick action game where the player controls the souls of a fish and bird who are in love, and seek to unite as one.
game.description:
Overview

Entwined is a dual-stick action game for the PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, and PlayStation Vita developed by Pixel Opus. The game was announced on June 9th, 2014 during the E3 Sony Press conference and released the same day on the PlayStation Store for the PlayStation 4. The PlayStation 3 And PlayStation Vita versions were released around a month later in July.

Entwined is a visually abstract game about two souls that are in love, represented as a blue bird and a yellow fish. Once the two souls unite as one they become a magnificent green dragon. The game features 9 stages, each labeled as a different lifetime and plays into the games overall theme. The story is intentionally vague and aside from the opening cut-scene most of the story is left up to player interpretation.

Gameplay

The player controls both souls simultaneously, the fish with the left analog stick and the bird with the right. To complete a level the player must collect enough of the same colored orb to fill the corresponding meter, one meter for each soul. Players must also guide the souls through the shapes matching their color, failing to do so will drain the meter. For green shapes both souls must fly through together. Once both meters are filled and flashing, the player must successfully navigate a series of shapes to connect the souls as one and become the dragon.

Once a dragon the player will navigate freely around an arena collecting both colored orbs to fill in a final meter which allows the dragon to release a light trail behind it. When that meter has been depleted a portal to the next stage will open, simply fly through it to progress.
game.name: Entwined

game.deck: Sackboy arrives on PlayStation 4 with some new friends.
game.description:
Overview

LittleBigPlanet 3 is the third game in the main LittleBigPlanet series and the first of the series on the PlayStation 4. LittleBigPlanet 3 introduces the ability to create levels with 16 layers depth to them, rather than the three available in previous games. The game also introduces three new playable characters to the franchise; Swoop, OddSock and Toggle. Each of these characters has their own special abilities that players can use to help complete levels.

LittleBigPlanet 3 allows players to create and share their own levels across PS3 and PS4, as well as play the 9 million existing levels created in previous games.

Music

LittleBigPlanet 3's soundtrack comprises an original score and a variety of licensed music tracks. The original soundtrack is available to purchase on iTunes (in the US) and feautures 17 tracks from composers Si Begg, Winifred Phillips and Paul Thomson, among others.

Original Sountrack

game.deck: inFamous: First Light is both DLC for inFamous: Second Son and a standalone, downloadable title from Sucker Punch.
game.description:
Overview

Developed by Sucker Punch, inFamous: First Light is an open world and arena combat game released for Playstation 4 on August 14, 2014 as stand-alone content in the inFamous franchise.. The game was available to PS+ members for free during the month of January of 2015. The player controls Fetch, a girl with the powers stemming from neon energy, as she retells the story of her recent past in Seattle.

Gameplay

Players take control of Fetch in both an arena and open world environment. The events of the arena take part in the present while the open world is a telling of events from Fetches past. Fetch absorbs neon energy from her surroundings to fuel the powers that become available as the story progresses. The open world contains optional tasks and challenges which reward the player with SP that is spent to purchase upgrades for Fetch's powers. In addition to the open world, Fetch can also take part in arena challenges that are initiated from the start menu.

The city may be traversed by taking the form of neon, which allows Fetch to air dash, climb vertical surfaces, and jump farther.

Combat includes melee and ranged play-styles. Melee allows Fetch to stock one hit finishers, while ranged attacks vary from simple to homing projectiles. Early on in the game, Fetch is given the ability to incapacitate enemies by aiming at the enemies specific body parts in the zoomed in mode, which also slows time for a short period.
game.name: inFamous: First Light

game.aliases: Project Beast Bloodborne: The Old Hunters
game.deck: An action role playing game by FromSoftware, marking the studio's debut on the PlayStation 4. It shares creative roots, as well as gameplay elements, with the Souls series.
game.description:
Overview

Bloodborne is an action-RPG developed by FromSoftware, Inc. and SCE Japan Studio with Hidetaka Miyazaki of Demon's Souls and Dark Souls fame acting as lead director.

The game was originally announced to be released on the PlayStation 4 on February 5, 2015 in Japan and February 6, 2015 in North America and Europe. However, on November 12, 2014, Sony delayed the game's North American release to March 24, its European release to March 25, and its Japanese release to March 26.

Gameplay

Combat Mechanics

Bloodborne plays in a similar fashion to the Souls games which came before it, but the similarities end with how the characters control and animate. The gameplay strategy which rose to prominence in previous games relied heavily on using a shield and staying behind it, a tactic actively discouraged in Bloodborne. In fact, there is only one shield in Bloodborne and the item description reads as follows: "Shields are nice, but not if they engender passivity." Subsequently, players can no longer rely on a thick piece of metal to protect them from everything, and must adopt a quicker and more aggressive style of play to survive in Yharnam.

Off-hand equipment has been replaced with firearms, sporting variants such as pistols, shotguns, and rifles. It is the main tool of defense, capable of interrupting enemies and countering their attacks. Timing the gunshot right before an attack connects forces the enemy into a staggered state, left vulnerable to a "visceral attack," a high damage strike that can be performed even on some Bosses.

Coupled with the visceral attack is the new health regain mechanic. When players take damage their life bar does not diminish instantly. Instead, the damage taken can be "recovered" by pressing the attack and hitting enemies while in this temporary state. This risk vs. reward system in the combat is now something to always keep in mind. An example is being hit while having already fired a shot and staggered an enemy, the player can enter a visceral attack animation and regain all health lost.

Guns use quicksilver bullets for ammunition, which can be either purchased, found in the world, or in an emergency situation traded for a portion of the player's health in order to have five "blood bullets."

Some weapons in Bloodborne are called "trick weapons," and are capable of switching between two forms at the press of a button. Players can even transform weapons mid-attack, giving each weapon a truly diverse and unique set of attacks. An example of these is the Threaded Cane, which can switch between a cane, as the name implies, and a whip, at the player's control. Mastering a trick weapon's alternate mode is essential for effectively surviving in the harsh world of Bloodborne, with over 20 trick weapons to choose from, each with its own variations and unique move set.

Evading attacks is now done slightly differently. Players can roll just like in previous games; however they are no longer affected by the equipment burden, and can roll at full speed no matter what armor is worn. While locked on to enemies the roll becomes a quick step or side step that covers a lot more ground and has many more invincibility frames, allowing the player to get away or press the attack. Each variation of the dodge mechanic can be instantly turned into an attack that varies depending on the direction dodged and the weapon equipped.

Together, these changes make the combat in Bloodborne a much more frantic and fast paced affair than in its predecessors.

Death and Healing

When the player dies in Bloodborne they lose all of their "Blood Echoes," the equivalent currency to souls in the previous games. They can either be in a pool of blood on the ground or be infused in random enemies near the area the player died. To retrieve the echoes one must kill the infused enemy or pick up the blood stain. Encounters with bosses always leave a pool on the ground, while dying outside of boss areas may lead to either infusion or a blood pool. If the player dies before retrieval the echoes are gone for good.

Reusable healing items are also dropped in Bloodborne, as the main source of healing are items called Blood Vials, which are primarily taken from corpses of enemies throughout the game, but can be purchased as well, similarly to the various moon grasses seen in Demon's Souls. There are also NPC characters that can offer their blood in vials, each with their own special attributes.

Vials and bullets both cap at 20; any extras of these picked up will go into the player's stash and refill the inventory upon death. There are runes in the game that can increase the maximum carrying capacity of vials and bullets, but they are only available later in the game.

Players can also be healed if one of their messages is rated as "Fine," but this is not something that can be relied on.

Story

Bloodborne is set in the Gothic city of Yharnam, once famous for a fabled remedy that could, supposedly, cure any ailment. The world is under siege by a beast plague, which infects and transforms humans into terrifying creatures.

The player is a human infected with this plague, who must traverse the ruined city of Yharnam and its many terrors and attempt to find a cure without losing their own humanity in the process.

Chalice Dungeons

Another new feature in Bloodborne is the Chalice Dungeon, an optional, procedurally generated dungeon set beneath Yharnam. A chalice dungeon is generated when a player brings a special chalice item to it, and once generated it remains the same for the rest of the playthrough, although chalice dungeons can be shared with others.

Some of the features of the Chalice Dungeon include:

  • Chalice Dungeons spawn Bosses that the player must face in order to progress. It is unclear as to what bosses the dungeon will spawn on generation.
  • In order to co-op in a Chalice Dungeon, both hosting and joining players must have created a dungeon of that chalice at least once.
  • Only the "Root" variants of Chalices provide completely procedurally generated dungeons, while regular Chalices provide only fixed dungeons.

game.deck: The second mainline entry in the Dead Island franchise.
game.description:
Overview

Set a handful of years post-Dead Island: Riptide, the zombie infection has now spread into the American state of California. Four new characters, all of whom are immune to the infection, must now take up whatever weaponry they can find in order to survive the encroaching apocalypse.

Gameplay

Gameplay in Dead Island 2 is highly reminiscent of its predecessors, with it featuring the same brand of analogue-control melee combat for use against shambling hordes of zombies -- weapon crafting returns as well. What is new, however, is the inclusion of dual-wielding, which includes players being able to equip a ranged weapon in one hand and a melee weapon in the other. Players can also craft their unique weaponry anywhere in the world without the use of a workbench.

Cooperative play is once again available, only now has a capacity of eight, raised from the original Dead Island's four.

The world of Dead Island 2 is open-ended and there is no actual 'end' to the game. Instead, the world is said to continually introduce new missions within the world as players explore. Players will also come into contact with other players in the world at random as well, similar to games such as Destiny and Journey.

Development

Dead Island 2 was announced during E3, 2014 amidst Sony's conference. There was no gameplay shown, but instead a CG trailer. However unlike the original's own CG announcement trailer, Dead Island 2's depicted a much more comical and rambunctious tone. After the trailer had aired, there was much speculation over whether American actor and musician Jack Black was starring in it, due to VO from one of the characters bearing a resemblance. Jack Black himself later denied any involvement with the game during a Reddit 'Ask Me Anything' event.

A possible first for the industry, a cat--called Rick Furry in the game--underwent motion-capture for Dead Island 2. Many of the zombies' faces are modelled after developers working at YAGER.

On July 14th, Deep Silver announced that YAGER were to be no longer developing Dead Island 2. Timo Ullmann, the managing director at YAGER, stated that they and Deep Silver had a ''difference of vision'' towards the game, which lead to their departure.
game.name: Dead Island 2

game.deck: The sequel to the comedic fantasy world of Magicka tells the tale of a new group of powerful Wizards as they battle evil in a world almost devoid of other Wizards.
game.description:
Overview

Magicka 2 is a top-down action-adventure game developed by Pieces and published by Paradox for the PlayStation 4 (via PlayStation Network) and PC (via Steam) on May 26, 2015.

It is the sequel to Arrowhead's 2011 game Magicka, telling the tale of a new group of one-to-four Wizards set over 40 years after the original game (during which the world of Midgrd has been almost wiped free of Wizards after the "Wizard Wars").

The game features a refined version of the original's "dynamic spellcasting system", adding the ability to "quickcast" certain spells (with cooldown timers) while reducing reliance on combined elements (requiring players to focus on the elemental weaknesses of their enemies).
game.name: Magicka 2

game.deck: A surreal puzzle game in which the player guides a narcoleptic sleepwalker to his bed, moving objects in each level to ensure he gets there safely.
game.description:
Overview

Back to Bed is a puzzle game by Bedtime Digital Games, an indie studio formed by a small group of Danish students. It takes place in a surreal, Escheresque dream world, through which the player must guide a sleepwalking man safely to his bed by moving objects around.

Development

Back to Bed began as a student project for the Danish National Academy of Digital Interactive Entertainment (DADIU), and was a collaboration between many students of various schools. The original prototype was met with great praise, which encouraged a small section of the development team to expand the prototype into a full game. Funding was originally sought through Kickstarter, with later support from Danish investment company Capnova, who had previously helped fund Limbo.

System Requirements

PC

Minimum

  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 1.8Ghz or equivalent (lower might work but is untested)
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Core HD Graphics 3000/4000, NVIDIA 8800 GT, ATI Radeon HD 4850 or better
  • DirectX: Version 9.0c
  • Hard Drive: 600 MB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible sound card
  • Additional Notes: Controller support: Xbox 360, Xbox One, Playstation 3, Playstation 4, several Logitech and miscellaneous controllers.

Mac

Minimum

  • OS: Snow Leopard 10.6.8 or newer
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 1.8Ghz or equivalent (lower might work but is untested)
  • Memory: 3 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Core HD Graphics 3000/4000, Nvidia GeForce GT 330M, ATI Radeon HD 4850 or better
  • Hard Drive: 600 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Controller support: Xbox 360, Playstation 3, Playstation 4, several Logitech and miscellaneous controllers.

Linux

Minimum

  • OS: Ubuntu 12.04 or newer (other distros may work)
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 1.8Ghz or equivalent (lower might work but is untested)
  • Memory: 3 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Core HD Graphics 3000/4000, NVIDIA 8800 GT, ATI Radeon HD 4850 or better
  • Hard Drive: 600 MB available space

game.deck: Tekken 7 is the final chapter of the Mishima family's storyline.
game.description:
Overview

Tekken 7, the next primary entry in Bandai Namco's Tekken series, was first announced via leak on July 13th, 2014 and officially revealed by series creator Katsuhiro Harada later that day at EVO 2014 with a cinematic trailer. The game is being developed on Unreal Engine 4.

The first location tests of the arcade game are being held in Tokyo and Osaka from October 3 to 5, 2014. The arcade version will receive a wide location test release in Asia in December 2014. The game's first wide arcade release is slated for February 18, 2015. Home ports have not yet been announced, but are incredibly likely.

Plot

In the initial teaser trailer, Kazuya Mishima's mother Kazumi states that she must stop Heihachi. She also makes mention of Kazuya inheriting her powers, referencing the origins of Kazuya and his son Jin Kazama's Devil Gene powers, long thought to have been given to Kazuya by the devil that saved his life (in exchange for his soul) as a child.

According to Harada during San Diego Comic Con 2014, the story will be more involved than previous Tekkens, and will revolve around the reason Heihachi killed Kazumi. Both he and the extended teaser shown that day indicated that Tekken 7 will be the final chapter of the series to revolve around the Mishima family blood feud.

Characters

New characters include:

  • Katarina Alves
  • Claudio Serafino
  • Lucky Chloe
  • Shaheen
  • Josie Rizal
  • Gigas

Returning characters:

  • Alisa Bosconovitch
  • Asuka Kazama
  • Bryan Fury
  • Devil Jin
  • Feng Wei
  • Heihachi Mishima
  • Hwoarang
  • Kazuya Mishima
  • Jack (Jack-7 model)
  • Jin Kazama
  • King
  • Lars Alexandersson
  • Leo
  • Lili Rochefort
  • Ling Xiaoyu
  • Marshall Law
  • Paul Phoenix
  • Sergei Dragunov
  • Steve Fox
  • Yoshimitsu
game.name: Tekken 7

Fire rockets 360 degrees around the reluctant hero Weldon, using them to carve a path to freedom. Hone your skills to maintain momentum and crush time trials, or master the nuances of rocket trajectories to complete levels using as few rockets as possible.

game.deck: A split-screen, multiplayer first-person shooter in which all players are invisible, and must "screen look" - analyze what the other players are seeing - to locate their opponents.
game.description:
Overview

Screencheat is a multiplayer first-person shooter currently in development by Samurai Punk and set to release on the PC.

Gameplay

Screencheat is a 1-4 player arena shooter where each player can see the viewpoint of the other players. Unlike other multiplayer FPS games, player models are not rendered in game so the only way to figure out where opponents are is to look at their viewpoint on your screen, or "screen look" as it is most commonly known. The game offers both online and local play, and the splitscreen image is still displayed in online play.
game.name: Screencheat

game.deck: A 2D shooter/platformer from Two Tribes.
game.description:
Overview

RIVE is a sci-fi 2D shooter/platformer created by the Dutch indie company Two Tribes. It is the first game released after the closure of the company's development studio, Two Tribes B.V.

RIVE was announced on July 29 2014 as for release on the PC, Wii U, PS4 and Xbox One in early 2015. Two Tribes will be handling the PC and Wii U versions in-house while PS4 and Xbox One ports will be done by an outside studio, despite having already completed about 90% of the engine porting for PS4 themselves.

RIVE was created with the Toki Tori 2 engine.
game.name: RIVE: The Metal Wrecking, Robot Hacking Shooter

game.deck: A Metroidvania-style sci-fi action adventure game from Renegade Kid.
game.description:
Overview

Xeodrifter is a sci-fi action adventure game developed and published by Renegade Kid for the PC, Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo 3DS, PlayStation Vita and the PlayStation 4. The player is tasked with repairing a spaceship by exploring an alien world, fighting ancient guardians and learning the secrets of a long lost supreme culture.

Story

An interstellar drifter who is exploring a small cluster of planets in the Omega sector is marooned after a collision with a rogue asteroid damages his warp core. He notices energy signatures on one of the planets that just might provide the right materials to fix his damaged warp core. What begins as a routine mission to fix his spacecraft spirals out of control and now he must fight to survive by shooting and exploring his way through an alien landscape.

Development

Xeodrifter came about after Renegade Kid's Jools Watsham mocked up a 2D de-make of their first person adventure MOON Chronicles for fun. This spurred the desire to create an original game in the Metroidvania style.

A Wii U port was announced in June of 2015 and was released a month later on July, 30 2015. A version titled Xeodrifter: Special Edition was announced for the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation Vita and was released on the September, 1 2015 and was included as part of that months PlayStation Plus promotion.

Gameplay

Xeodrifter is similar to games like those from the Metroid and Castlevania series. The player must explore and unlock abilities in order to progress through the levels. It's not entirely clear at the start what order the player should explore the worlds available to them in. Abilities are unlocked by beating bosses.

Other than ability unlockables the player can gain more health and weapon upgrades. The basic gun can be upgraded with features like a higher rate of fire, higher damage, bullet spread and wave bullets.
game.name: Xeodrifter

game.deck: Ziggurat is a first-person dungeon crawling game from Milkstone Studios.
game.description:
Overview

The game was first made available on Steam Early Access on August 13, 2014. Its full release was on October 23, 2014. It was released on the Xbox One on March 20, 2015, with a PlayStation 4 release following in April.

Gameplay

Ziggurat is a first-person dungeon crawler that features randomly generated levels populated with a random spread of a variety of monsters ranging from flaming skulls that charge at the player (not unlike the flaming skulls in DOOM 3) to poisonous mushrooms that fire homing missiles and emit dangerous clouds of noxious gas.

The quick pace of movement and focus on casting different forms of magical projectiles from wands, staves and magic tomes evokes comparison with the likes of Hexen. Each type of magical weapon is fuelled by a separate kind of mana, making thoughtful balancing of each weapon's use critical to success in battle. Each weapon has an alternate fire which consumes more mana but is often better in tight situations - the wand's alternate fire is a shotgun-like spread which is more effective at close range, for example, while the stave's alt-fire dramatically increases its rate of fire.

Rooms are laid out randomly across a level with small corridors connecting them. When a player enters a room, its monsters spawn in waves and the doors lock until all enemies have been dispatched. When killed, monsters drop experience which can be used to level up. Upon levelling up, the player can chose between two randomly selected perks from a large pool of possible upgrades. More cards are added to the pool of potential perks by earning milestones and clearing runs successfully.

There are multiple playable characters to play as with each offering a different set of strengths and weaknesses. For example, Argo, the starting character, has balanced stats with no particular deficits or advantages, while Kraz, the first unlockable character, is proficient with Wands but slightly weaker with all other forms of weaponry.

The player must proceed through a level's rooms earning experience and searching for the Portal Key, which can then be taken to that level's Boss Room where a fight with a randomly selected Boss will begin. If the player defeats the boss, a portal will open to the next floor of the dungeon. Before beginning the next floor, however, a screen showing statistics about the last floor is displayed and the option is given for the player to save and quit, allowing progress to be continued at a later date. If the player dies, the game is over and the player must start anew in a fresh dungeon, but unlocked characters and perks are persistent and can still be accessed.

The rooms of the dungeon themselves can have random properties assigned to them which modify the gameplay in some way. For example, the "Red Moon" room modifier causes Alchemy-based weaponry to deal +50% damage, while causing all other weapons to deal half their usual damage. Some rooms do not contain monsters, but instead are host to various traps and deadly devices that the player must navigate to progress.

System Requirements

PC

Minimum

  • OS: Windows XP
  • Processor: Dual Core processor
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX 10 capable hardware
  • DirectX: Version 9.0c
  • Hard Drive: 800 MB available space

Recommended

  • OS: Windows 7 or newer
  • Processor: Quad core processor
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce 460 or better
  • Hard Drive: 1 GB available space

Mac

  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2 Graphics card
  • Hard Drive: 800 MB available space

Linux

Minimum

  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2 Graphics card
  • Hard Drive: 800 MB available space

Recommended

  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce 460 or better
  • Hard Drive: 1 GB available space
game.name: Ziggurat
